abstract: Hugh McColl Jr., who built Bank of America into the behemoth it is today, apparently feels really good about the bank’s new chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
snippet: Hugh McColl Jr., who built Bank of America into the behemoth it is today, apparently feels really good about the bank’s new chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.
lead_paragraph: Hugh McColl Jr., who built Bank of America into the behemoth it is today, apparently feels really good about the bank’s new chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan.

headline.main: Former BofA Chief Gives Moynihan High Marks

abstract: The I.P.O. pipeline in the United States is filling up as companies once afraid of braving the capital markets are now lining up to for initial public offerings. A fair number of these companies, especially in the financial industry, are looking to spin off businesses at lucrative prices.
snippet: The I.P.O. pipeline in the United States is filling up as companies once afraid of braving the capital markets are now lining up to for initial public offerings. A fair number of these companies, especially in the financial industry, are looking t...
lead_paragraph: The I.P.O. pipeline in the United States is filling up as companies once afraid of braving the capital markets are now lining up to for initial public offerings. A fair number of these companies, especially in the financial industry, are looking to spin off businesses at lucrative prices.

headline.main: I.P.O. Market Begins to Regain Its Luster
